website_summaries.verdict: This feeder enables you to provide squirrels with corn, peanuts, and other tasty treats.
pros: of corn, peanuts, and other foods
Comes with mounting hardware that enables you to quickly and seamlessly set up the feeder
Steel construction with a powder-coated green finish ensures the feeder will maintain its appearance for an extended period of time
Arrives fully assembled for added convenience
cons: Lid tends to be heavy, which can make it tough for squirrels to get food from the feeder

customer_reviews.title: Finally! A feeder that is bluejay proof!
customer_reviews.text: We love the feeder because the food inside doesnt get wet when it rains. The feeder is made of a steel & covered with a hammerite green paint so it's durable. The squirrels figured out how to access the nuts the first day we put it out.. Finally! a feeder that the bluejays can't access & swipe the squirrel's nuts! We placed it on a small table so we can watch them feed from inside the house. We secured it with a shoestring in the back to keep it getting tipped over by the squirrels.
customer_reviews.author: LaLaBelair

customer_reviews.title: Squirrel Diner May Go Out Of Business!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made feeder. I purchased this feeder at the same time as the other two feeders same company, different models). I mounted all 3 on oak trees. This feeder, for some unknown reason, has never been touched by any critter. The other two are filled and emptied daily. The lid isn't any more difficult to open than the other two. Maybe it's because it's made of metal? I tried moving it to a different location, same results. It doesn't have a ledge for the beastie to stand or sit on like the other two, but I placed it so the tree branch acted as a ledge. Maybe a different type of food will do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: uncleskippy

customer_reviews.title: Good feeder
customer_reviews.text: It took the squirrels awhile to figure out how to use this feeder. I have read reviews where the squirrels destroyed the plastic so I initially propped the door of the container open to be easy for the squirrels. After awhile, I closed the lid and the squirrels quickly learned how to open the lid. I note other people have had problems but I think training the squirrels that they had to come through the top by making it easy on them led to them quickly learning to open the lid.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Weber

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels love it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this feeder because I love feeding the squirrels. I have a few that I hand feed and I also hide nuts around the patio for them to hunt. They seem to love hunting for them. I was looking for a feeder that would challenge the squirrels. It took them a few days to figure it out and it was fun to watch. Wish they made more feeders that would challenge them because they really are pretty smart and seem to enjoy the game. Would definitely recommend this feeder for anyone who loves to feed the squirrels.
customer_reviews.author: Kayak Lover

customer_reviews.title: Not my smartest purchase
customer_reviews.text: Two issues that I should have caught before ordering...no place for the squirrels to perch and the metal top is heavier than I would like since it falls down on their neck when they are trying to get food inside. Plus I am now concerned about this metal feeder during the winter since metal freezes quicker than wood. I have a bungee cord around the lid to keep it open and will go back to my wooden one this coming winter.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Holds a lot but the squirrels have to eat inside it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I wanted a feeder that would hold enough food to keep me from having to refill it too often,and this one holds a lot of food. But - I didn't consider that there is no platform for the squirrels to stand on while eating. So they have to climb inside to eat - which means I can't fill it all the way, and because they eat inside it, it often looks full when it actually just has tons of shells and cast-offs from the food they've eaten already. It's held up well, but I will be purchasing a different style that includes a platform.
customer_reviews.author: Sinnickel

customer_reviews.title: My Squirrels Love These
customer_reviews.text: It took a couple of days for them to get used to the metal flap doors on the top and husband built a stand for them to have perch on while eating. They are emptying them every other day since about 4 of them come to eat. When they get empty the squirrels slam the lids to get my attention. Thanks be that they are more durable than the wooden feeders.
customer_reviews.author: Penelope Housos

customer_reviews.title: Outthinking the squirrels!
customer_reviews.text: We have an excess of squirrels. 6 or more hang around the bird feeder and it's become a full-time job to chase them off. Instead of spending a lot of useless time looking out the window and trying to scare them away, we decided to outflank them with a distraction. It's perfect! True, we do have one that can't seem to get the hang of opening the lid and we have created a "bully squirrel" that runs all the other ones off...but it's WAY better than trying to police the birdfeeder! Super product! Made so well - it was definitely worth it!
customer_reviews.author: BuyIt4me

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP PLASTIC LINER DEGRADES FAST. BUY SOMETHING ELSE
customer_reviews.text: Looks and is sturdy except for the flimsy plastic barrier lining the inside front between the metal bars. This degrades quickly in the sun and birds or squirrels break through it. The company does not offer replacements at any price. I will buy something else next time. This rating would be a 5 if they offered replacement plastic barriers.
customer_reviews.author: SRdto

customer_reviews.title: Nice Feeder But Our Squirrels Not Interested.
customer_reviews.text: Well one week later and not a squirrel in sight of the feeder. It is well made, looks nice hanging on the fence. i started with Black Sunflower seeds, the same as my old wooden feeder that aged out but maybe not the right feed for this one. There must be a secret to getting squirrels interested, maybe I will stumble on a food they can smell and want to eat.
customer_reviews.author: L.Elmore

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: This squirrel feeder is nice quality and performs exactly as described. It took our squirrels about a week to figure out how to open the lid. Now they sit inside with it closed or fight each other for space and food. It's very entertaining and keeps them and the mess off my porch. There is no hardware enclosed for hanging so I used two screws and a ziptie to attach to the outside rails of the porch. The kids also really love watching all the activity. No issues with quality or sharp edges. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: nativepeach

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality
customer_reviews.text: This took almost two months to get delivered. The item itself is well made and durable. Not sure if the squirrels in my yard are idiots, but they have a VERY tough time figuring out how to actually access the peanuts. There are some teeth marks on the plexiglass from the squirrels trying to get in but so far no cracks or chips.
customer_reviews.author: Angela C.

customer_reviews.title: Less messy, good for squirrels to have something to figure out
customer_reviews.text: It gets dinged one star for not being easy to clean once it's secured (I used cable ties to attach to deck). Not the end of the world. The squirrels live it- and once they figured it out, it's been a hoot watching them get in (and camp out for a while) while another sits on the roof (there are air holes to prevent suffocation), or chase each other in and out. It's also not as messy as other feeding options. The 'debris' stays inside- and I use a paper cup to scoop it out.
customer_reviews.author: JillinoisRNTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Squirrel Feeder
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work to well as a squirrel feeder. It was difficult for them to get the top up to access the feed because there was nowhere for them to stand. They had to hang from the tree with their back feet, try to lift the top with one paw and reach in and grab food with the other one. Using it to store cracked corn for the ducks now. Works great for that.
customer_reviews.author: Cathryn

customer_reviews.title: Raccoons love it!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install but after attaching to the top of my fence post and filling it with delicious peanuts and sunflower seeds, it took forever for the squirrels to figure out how to open it. However, the raccoons had it figured out in one night. They emptied it and left all the peanut shells on the ground. I haven't filled it since and probably won't use it again.
customer_reviews.author: 49 Geese

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, seems heavy duty, large capacity for peanuts
customer_reviews.text: Easy to mount, built strong, lid/top is a little heavy, the small squirrels have difficulty getting it up to feed, a strategically placed deck screw helps the smaller squirrels obtain easier access, otherwise a 5star unit. Large capacity storage 👍🏻👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: J.B.E. 😜

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: we bought this product many times....we mounted it on our railing in front of our sliding doors for the purpose of watching and keeping our cat entertained....love it....it is so cute to see the squirrels lift the lid and get the peanuts and scamper down the railing to hide them for the winter....am so glad that the big crows have not figured out how to get the peanuts...all and all a great product....and will but again when this one wears out....
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Wissinger

customer_reviews.title: It's one thing to give the squirrels a challenge, but I can't see how they can perch on the slippery, downsloping ledge?
customer_reviews.text: If you don't have a tree handy and only a metal post, it is a bit tough to mount. Once it is mounted the poor squirrels keep slipping of the feeder because the ledge doesn't offer a toe hold. Ultimately I made a wooden shelve and now the critters are coming and at least one has figured out how to open the lid. Still I think this is a product that needs some more designing.
customer_reviews.author: Gosh Golly

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels love it
customer_reviews.text: As you can see by the photos the squirrels love it Overfilled it so that the lid was up at first. After they ate the peanuts down it took very little time for them to figure it out. Great product. Simple to install.
customer_reviews.author: David Scheitler

customer_reviews.title: Keeps food clean and dry but squirrels have a really hard time getting to the food.
customer_reviews.text: I love that this holds a good amount of squirrel food and keeps it clean and dry. What I do not like about the product is that the base is not large enough for the squirrels to stand on to try and push open the top. They tend to end up on the side of the feeder and then can't seem to get enough leverage to push up the top to get access to the food. Tried propping to top open but could not find anything that would stay in place or that the squirrels didn't destroy. Product is too expensive to have such a poor design and proved to be useless as a squirrel feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie S.

customer_reviews.title: Really good Squirrel feeders
customer_reviews.text: I ended up buying 2 of these. I like them a lot and so do the Squirrels. They keep the food off the ground and keeps it clean and dry. These are built very well and attached easily to trees I have. I didn't want to butcher the tree so I used zip ties and they worked perfectly. I added weather stripping to the inside of the lid that did the trick in neutralizing the clang from the lid while the Squirrels are eating. These feeders are well made and the Squirrels love em.
customer_reviews.author: jeffiboy

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels CANNOT OPEN Lid- total waste of money!!
customer_reviews.text: TERRIBLE PRODUCT!! If you are concerned your squirrels won’t be able to open the lid, you should be. Mine cannot. Even with shelled peanuts as motivation. I’m so disappointed in this product. I replaced a feeder I had because I was tired of replacing glass jars... big mistake. Now I have to keep the top of this one propped open with a spatula so they can eat. They knock the spatula out so I make several trips a day replacing it. This feeder is a tedious waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: kip rushton

customer_reviews.title: Great feeder, Squirrels need time to get used to it.
customer_reviews.text: Love the shape and look of this feeder. Attached it to tree and stuck sandpaper to the ledge to give the squirrels some extra grip while they get to know how to use it, The younger squirrels seemed the fastest to catch on and now there is a constant stream of activity, very amusing to watch and great opportunities for cute pictures . I will try and attach a video but having problems loading right now.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I bought a very similar one some years ago and the critters managed to 'eat' the plastic window. This one seems to have a heavier gauge plastic for the window and is much easier to hang on my tree. Very durable, easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Mccroskey

customer_reviews.title: Love squirrel watching
customer_reviews.text: Great squirrel feeder. I love feeding and watching the squirrels. I was so excited to get this after watching the videos of squirrels getting into the feeder for the food. Well, my squirrels must not be very smart because they could not figure out how to open the lid and get the medley of food I had put in there for them. ALL WAS NOT LOST.... I took out the clear plastic cover in the front and now I am enjoying watching the squirrels reach in for their meal! They truly are great entertainers.
customer_reviews.author: BRENDA

customer_reviews.title: Shiny and Slick  Moderately dysfunctional
customer_reviews.text: This product is noteworthy for the cocky literature that comes with it, and for its moderate level of dysfunctionality. The squirrels could only access the peanuts when it was full. When it got down to half full the squirrels could not get more. It also looked like the shiny non painted surfaces might be ready to start rusting as soon as they saw the light of day and raindrops.
customer_reviews.author: Concerned Consumer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT ENTERTAINMENT!
customer_reviews.text: OK, so i entertain easily, LOL very fast to install with a couple of screws into my tree i have 3 squirrels who feed from this ALL DAY and have to 'battle' with the openings and the lid to get their peanut (which is why it is so entertaining!!)
customer_reviews.author: B. Pennell

customer_reviews.title: Fun to watch the squirrels figure it out
customer_reviews.text: It took about 10 minutes for the squirrels to figure out how to get the peanuts out, then we had a steady stream of squirrels visiting our back fence. Dogs love barking at the squirrels and the squirrels love taunting the dogs. Neighbor on the other side of the fence didn't appreciate the mound of peanut shells the squirrels tossed on his side. Oh well, squirrels are still fun to watch as they pull peanuts out and chatter at the dogs.
customer_reviews.author: limu

customer_reviews.title: The squirrels love it!
customer_reviews.text: It’s been fun watching the squirrels enjoy this. The baby ones climb all the way inside. The worse part is it’s like having teenage boys in the house again they eat nonstop.
customer_reviews.author: Kzc

customer_reviews.title: works good and attracts squirrels
customer_reviews.text: seems they are getting the hang of opening the door. It took a few days for them to figure it out. At first they would scare themselves when the lid would shut.
customer_reviews.author: Rosalynn Dressel

customer_reviews.title: I loved this, but the squirrels
customer_reviews.text: I loved this, but the squirrels, not so much. They didn't touch the dang thing and I tried putting peanuts in there, corn, and even the bird feed they like stealing from the birds so much. I think our squirrels are less than intelligent though if you ask me. Regardless, if you have smart squirrels, they should be able to figure this out in no time. Ours are just a little slow and/or lazy and didn't want to bother trying.
customer_reviews.author: hmg1111

customer_reviews.title: Metal construction should last forever.
customer_reviews.text: We have look everywhere for a good squirrel feeder. We have purchased many. Most have plastic windows and wood construction. This construction material is simply incompatible with squirrels. This one is metal and looks like it will last forever. Best feature is that the squirrels can in but not those pesky Blue Jays.
customer_reviews.author: B. Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Excellent squirrel feeder!
customer_reviews.text: The feeder is very sturdy, and holds a lot of food. We have several squirrels visiting our porch each day, so I mounted the feeder on our deck. I propped the lid open at first, so they would get used to taking peanuts from it. That afternoon I let the lid close and watched the reactions. Interesting to note our female figured out how to open the lid within a few minutes; the males needed a few extra days. Very pleased with the item.
customer_reviews.author: DebNoCo

customer_reviews.title: Good size
customer_reviews.text: It was tricky for them to get into, so my husband built a lip or platform for the to have better leverage to lift the lid. Now Skippy, Jiffy & peanut enjoy their vending and playground. So fun to watch.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline

customer_reviews.title: My sneaky Squirrel loves this thing.
customer_reviews.text: My sneaky Squirrel loves this thing. It makes a little noise when the door closes and it wakes him up from his nest in front of my house and as soon as I go in the house he grabs his peanuts. He is so cute!!
customer_reviews.author: Cherie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to fill
customer_reviews.text: Love these squirrel feeders. They’re so easy to fill and mount on a tree. They’re also very attractive. The only reason I didn’t give it 5 stars is that I had to prop the top open for the squirrels to access. Easily modified by just taking a long, small piece of branch and placing it across the back of the opened top.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Expect a learning curve for most squirrels
customer_reviews.text: The squirrels in our yard have had trouble figuring this out, and for the first several weeks they still kept trying for the bird feeders. Finally, a couple have learned how to open the top; for the rest, we bought a rotating corn feeder. I don’t think the product is to blame, though — we suspect some of our squirrels might not be super-bright. But I’m hoping the slower ones will catch on eventually by watching the one or two who have figured it out. Until then, I’ll scatter peanuts outside the feeder, and keep propping open the lid a bit.
customer_reviews.author: amy

customer_reviews.title: Great Feeder!
customer_reviews.text: Metal and holds enough for a family of squirrels. Always buy metal so they can't chew through! This suffices completely!
customer_reviews.author: Bear

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels can’t get to the food
customer_reviews.text: There is no way the squirrels can reach any of the food for the bottom 2/3 of the feeder. The feeder’s holes are at the top. It did not come with the mounting screws listed on the instructions
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice but missing parts
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice feeder. It is pretty sturdy and has several drainage holes in the bottom. The window lets you see when it is empty. I gave this item a '3 star' because, like several others, the screws for attaching the feeder were missing. As others have pointed out, it is easy to go to a store to buy replacements (and that is what I did), but this seems to be an ongoing problem and should be addressed.
customer_reviews.author: DAS

customer_reviews.title: Well-Made Feeder for the Local Wildlife
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made, sturdy and perfect for my furry friends. The only drawback is the clanging of the lid as the squirrels pull their heads out of the feeder, but it's easily fixed with a couple of felt tabs.
customer_reviews.author: GRRRRL

customer_reviews.title: and we love them. You have to prop them open though ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2, and we love them. You have to prop them open though because our squirrels are stupid. Also do not fill them completely the squirrels will eat the food and leave the empty shells and it will mold! Must clean them regularly. Also they sit and even sleep in them so make sure you wash them out.
customer_reviews.author: trishwriter

customer_reviews.title: Good feeder.
customer_reviews.text: The plastic cover over the windows needs to be a heavier plastic. The sun, and the Blue Jays, ruin the cover supplied on one I purchased earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: What fun!!
customer_reviews.text: Really like watching the squirrels in this thing especially when one is totally inside of it and another one has a surprise when he opens it up or when one sits on top when there is one inside......too funny! Great feeder!
customer_reviews.author: Kara723

customer_reviews.title: Great Diversion Tactic for Pesky Raccoons
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use as a raccoon feeder. Every spring the raccoons wreak havoc with my bird feeders, knocking them down and often damaging or destroying them. I converted this squirrel feeder by placing it on a 2 ft metal pole at about 6 inches off the ground, several yards away from the nearest bird feeder. BTW I use a mixture of 1/2 dog/1/2 cat food for the raccoons. Now I hear the metal lid clanging at night. When I go out in the morning the food is gone and all my bird feeders remain untouched.
customer_reviews.author: Tennessee Gardener

customer_reviews.title: Great feeder
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for a previous similar feeder that slowly deteriorated away from daily use. It is obvious that improvements have been made and it is a simpler design. One modification we make is to modify the clear plastic that covers the front slots to allow access to the peanuts from the front through 2 slots. This allows Blue Jays and similar peanut loving birds to get a peanut of two. It is fun to watch the squirrels and jays pick out the peanuts.
customer_reviews.author: RVer Surface user

customer_reviews.title: My husband attached this to one of our trees. ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband attached this to one of our trees. At first the squirrels were not interested but they soon got the hang of it. We really just use it during the winter so they have some food that is not wet. Has held up well in the elements.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to use for the squirrel
customer_reviews.text: Squirrel that lives in our tree is unable to open the flap. Will be buying a new squirrel feeder
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer T

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for squirrels, it works great. It took them two days to figure it out and now the blue jays don't get the peanuts. Great quality and very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Joni

customer_reviews.title: Hours of entertainment
customer_reviews.text: What a delight watching the squirrels feeding themselves took a little while to learn but now they've all caught on and I'm filling up the squirrel feeder every couple of days
customer_reviews.author: Jack M B Selway

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: The squirrel who inhabits my yard thanks you. He now has his OWN feeding station and leaves my bird feeders alone and only the small nuthatches and chickadees can share this with him. Really nice to no longer have my bird feeders ravaged and destroyed by him.
customer_reviews.author: P. Schulze

customer_reviews.title: Nice feeder
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to find a good squirrel feeder. This is all metal making it hard for squirrels to destroy. I put mixed squirrel feed in this. If I had room I would buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: MFG2414

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Feeder, Keep Making!!
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous squirrel feeder, holds a whole bag of peanuts. This is our second from this brand. We mounted it to a board with different screws so we could slip it off to clean and attached the board to the tree. Then, we added a hook to hold the lid open so the Blue Jays could also partake. This is metal, too, so it holds up. Our first one last about seven or so years.
customer_reviews.author: lovebird@iglobal.net

customer_reviews.title: No mounting hardware, otherwise fine.
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived. Seems sturdy. But did not come with any mounting hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: My squirrels are just stupid
customer_reviews.text: This is well made but my squirrels just can figure it out and it stays full. Dove try to get in there and you would think they would teach the squirrels but I guess they don't speak the same language.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Nice replacement for my previous wooden squirrel feeder that finally ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice replacement for my previous wooden squirrel feeder that finally had to be trashed. The squirrels (and raccoons!) found this right away. Would be 5 stars if there was a way the lid would close back automatically. Still, a nice item.
customer_reviews.author: Xaviersmama

customer_reviews.title: Value purchase
customer_reviews.text: Grn color blends in well, very sturdy. Squirrels still haven't figured it out but they are curious. Value purchase, very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amy P

customer_reviews.title: took the squirrels a little while to figure it out but they did.
customer_reviews.text: metal construction - sturdy but the plastic that fits inside and keeps the nuts from spilling out through the sides is very thin and flimsy- it is cracking and yellowing after a few months of use and the squirrels can easily chew through it to get at the nuts - they have not chewed it yet but a mouse has now learned to climb the tree and get into the feeder and take peanuts and seeds.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Fun watching the little ones figure out that the lid ...
customer_reviews.text: Replacements for a previous version that the critters kind of beat up. Fun watching the little ones figure out that the lid needs to open for peanuts. The old ones lost the plastic shield years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Scotty

customer_reviews.title: Nice little feeder
customer_reviews.text: Nailed it to my side fence. Works great, they go in and out of the top all day
customer_reviews.author: A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Best squirrel feeder ever
customer_reviews.text: Best squirrel feeder ever. Squirrels figured it out the first day it was installed. Had a large problem with the crows eating all the squirrel food. I did put a small platform under the feeder to allow the squirrels access in front of it but small enough the crows can't land. This has saved a lot of money not having to buy as many peanuts for the little critters.
customer_reviews.author: William C. Jamison Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great squirrel feeder!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item so that our backyard squirrels would stop raiding the bird feeder! It took a bit for the squirrels to learn how to lift the lid, but they took to it very quickly. The feeder is made of study metal with a heavy clear poly window.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: perfect feeder
customer_reviews.text: My squirrels love this feeder. But the first time I had to put a twig to hold the top up in order for them to learn how to lift. What's great is that the birds can't get to the food. I placed it on a tree in fromt of my living room so I get to watch them play every day.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Kolber

customer_reviews.title: Feeder
customer_reviews.text: A few of the younger squirrels have a problem opening the top. The great thing is it keeps 100% of the birds from eating the p-nuts. All in all, the squirrels seem to love it.
customer_reviews.author: William G. Doherty

customer_reviews.title: CRAP
customer_reviews.text: Extremely flimsy. There is no place for the squirrel to perch while eating. Poor design. Although I should have noticed that in the picture On the website. The packaging was damaged, basically due to the fact that the cardboard box was of the cheapest kind.
customer_reviews.author: FRED COHL

customer_reviews.title: It needs to have a much longer extension of platform on the bottom...
customer_reviews.text: I like this squirrel feeder, it's durable and study, but it seriously need to have a much longer and wider extension of the platform on the bottom of the feeder to allow squirrels to be able to stand on it more easily to pop up the lid; otherwise, I'd be given a 5 Star rating.
customer_reviews.author: LRS

customer_reviews.title: Good looking, a bit hard for the squirrels
customer_reviews.text: Looks good and is durable but poor squirrels have a bit of a problem getting the lid up at times.
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen L. Benson

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels but house
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install to where the squirrels can easily get to it. We all love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Rockey Roland

customer_reviews.title: Durable, Squirrels Love It
customer_reviews.text: This feeder is durable for all sorts of weathers, and it's easily attached to my deck. Just make sure the screws onto which the feeder slides are level or the feeder will look cockeyed. I take in my feeder at nights to keep from tempting raccoons and bears, so having the screws positioned properly is a must.
customer_reviews.author: Gridley

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Keeps the squirrels out of the bird feeders for the most part.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Plastic quickly broken
customer_reviews.text: Bought this feeder because I was concerned the wood ones would weather quickly. Within a week, the birds and squirrels broke the plastic "windows" and twisted the metal strips between the "windows". Wasn't able to find a product to replace the plastic and hold the peanuts in. Moved on to a wood one with a thick plastic window.
customer_reviews.author: M Taty

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels snack box
customer_reviews.text: I took a brush and propped open lid. During rain and snow had to keep closed so nuts stay dry. Squirrels love it when open. They grab nuts and sit by it to eat
customer_reviews.author: C Wondrack

customer_reviews.title: Not quite right.
customer_reviews.text: The ledge for the squirrels to sit on is too small I had to make a wooden extension.
customer_reviews.author: T. McKay

customer_reviews.title: The Best purchase ever
customer_reviews.text: My Stinky love it!! She learned very easier how to take her food from it ❤️🐿
customer_reviews.author: PAOLA

customer_reviews.title: My squirrels are either not strong or smart enough to get the lid up
customer_reviews.text: The feeder is well made with one exception. My squirrels are either not strong or smart enough to get the lid up. They would reach in through the upper openings until the feed level was too low. I rigged a clip that holds the lid up about 1.5" and now they go in and out and empty the Kaytee food in about 2 days. The lid is still low enough to keep the rain out. They are now very entertaining.
customer_reviews.author: L. Cadwell

customer_reviews.title: Needs a ledge maybe?
customer_reviews.text: I actually liked the look of this one better than my other feeder, but the squirrels seem confused by it. Maybe because the other feeder has a ledge in the front to stand on. Something to consider maybe? Otherwise love it!
customer_reviews.author: do fun lol

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. The squirrels figured it out pretty easily.
customer_reviews.author: J. Y. Tomechko

customer_reviews.title: This worked for a while, then the plastic holding the food in broke
customer_reviews.text: To hold the food in, there is a somewhat flimsy plastic piece. it broke after a while, rendering the unit useless.
customer_reviews.author: K-USA

customer_reviews.title: Happy squirrels
customer_reviews.text: Took a day and a half now the squirrels half figured it out. They are loving it mostly because they don't have to share their peanuts with the birds. Very happy furry friends
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This brings so much pleasure watching the squirrels go in and out of it!
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Squirrel feeders
customer_reviews.text: Squirr3el love getting the peanut out of this thing...works great
customer_reviews.author: Jane  Cordell

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to out yard : )
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for our little squirrel friends, and just the right size
customer_reviews.author: Charo Huntley

customer_reviews.title: I've had this for about a month and the squirrels ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about a month and the squirrels still don't know how to open it... I have to go every other day and take out the food and I place it on the ground... The only plus I'll say is that it's metal so it won't get damaged quick
customer_reviews.author: Black Diamond

customer_reviews.title: LID TOO HEAVY!
customer_reviews.text: By the time we got out to the lake to hang this feeder it was too late to return. Lid way too heavy for squirrel to lift. I watched them try and there was no way they could get under it. Will have to end up just ripping the top off so they can get to the food!!!! Very disappointed!!!!
customer_reviews.author: TERRI

customer_reviews.title: squirrels luv it
customer_reviews.text: hanging on the tree trunk. put in sunflower seeds and corn cobs. took squirrels a few weeks to figure it out. finally propped the lid open with a used corn cob so they could get their heads in. Now, they've learned how to push the lid open with their nose and head. they crawl into the feeder and pig out.
customer_reviews.author: Noe's Tutu

customer_reviews.title: Our wild squirrel got stuck in it and panicked! Returned it!
customer_reviews.text: Our wild squirrels got stuck inside it and panicked! Returned it!
customer_reviews.author: Rachael R.

customer_reviews.title: Entertainment plus.
customer_reviews.text: Great little device, if you fancy squirrels--and you've gotta love it when one of the critters parks himself inside the food-bin, protected under the lid and fends off all comers whilst chowing down on whatever you provide.
customer_reviews.author: RCHEV

customer_reviews.title: Very fun squirrel feeder
customer_reviews.text: Very fun squirrel feeder. I was tired of squirrels raiding my birdfeeders so set up their own separate dining area. This feeder is durable, keeps the peanuts dry and it's fun watching them learn how to open the top to get the nuts
customer_reviews.author: diane

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels love it!
customer_reviews.text: I like that the squirrel can get peanuts but not the blue jays. Mine is hanging from a palm tree in FL and I can watch the squirrels enjoying their treats.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon English

customer_reviews.title: Super nice! Aside for the banging noise the lid ...
customer_reviews.text: Super nice! Aside for the banging noise the lid makes but that's easy enough to fix, wraped some rope around the lid and now it doesn't slam when it opens and shuts.
customer_reviews.author: Mad Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great feeder
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Had to replace the hard plastic with wire, but that was no big deal. Did not take the squirrels long to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: CJM

customer_reviews.title: Sooo fun to watch the squirrels lift the lid to get ...
customer_reviews.text: Sooo fun to watch the squirrels lift the lid to get at the peanuts. Keeps the Blue Jays from emptying the feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Ladylib Santa Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels love it.
customer_reviews.text: I like the sturdy construction. It looks good even though it is abused by birds. The squirrels can get to it easily. The birds are dumbfounded.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: squirrels have hard time
customer_reviews.text: squirrels have a hard time getting at the food.not a very good design
customer_reviews.author: Charlie 8584

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I’ve watched a squirrel go in the feeder, it ate and then popped out of the box.😃
customer_reviews.author: KCM

customer_reviews.title: Holds a lot of peanuts but right away the birds ...
customer_reviews.text: Holds a lot of peanuts but right away the birds had pecked holes through the light weight plastic shield and we had to improvise.
customer_reviews.author: NANSEAS

customer_reviews.title: Built good. I have younger squirrels and they have a ...
customer_reviews.text: Built good . I have younger squirrels and they have a hard time getting into it.
customer_reviews.author: Susan M. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: It's a peanut holder
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure if our chipmunks and squirrels are just too stupid to figure it out ( opening the top ) or just don't like it .I had a similar one last year which they figured out pretty quick but not this one . Anyways, at least the bluejays can't get in it .
customer_reviews.author: Josef L

customer_reviews.title: Squirrel peanut feeder
customer_reviews.text: Really a neat feeder. Attached to fence. Squirrel is curious and checks out but hasn't figured it out yet.
customer_reviews.author: BonZim66

customer_reviews.title: Great squirrel feeder
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful little squirrel feeder. You will need to replace the plastic guard with chicken wire or something like that as the squirrels destroyed the plastic in no time. The feeder itself is sturdy and easy to mount to a post and has worked great since my husband replaced the plastic food shield with wire mesh.
customer_reviews.author: C. Jasper

product_meta.title: Woodlink Squirrel Diner Feeder Model 75590
product_meta.description: Woodlink Squirrel Diner provided a diversionary feeder for squirrels to keep them away from your bird feeder.The steel construction has a green powder coated finish that resists chewing. The quick release roof lifts off for easy filling and cleaning. Feeder includes mounting hardware for tree, post or deck. Give the squirrels their own food source to keep them away from your songbird feeders.
feature_bullets: Mounting hardware for tree, post or deck included
Woodlink Squirrel Diner Feeder has steel construction with powder coated green finish to resist chewing
Holds 4 lbs. of peanut, corn or wildlife mix

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
